classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, B4, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, E, F, and GE Elective. Courses in Upper-Division B and Upper-Division C should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to the online catalog for GE course selection and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR).

Any Free Elective course can go here. Recommended: Foreign Language 101.

Any Free Elective course can go here.

Upper-Division GE courses taken for a letter grade satisfy Major or Support course requirements which may require additional units of Free Electives to complete the 180 unit total degree requirement. Some free electives may need to be 300-400 level to ensure completion of the required minimum 60 units of upper-division. Consult a college advisor for more information.

Any Upper Division Elective (HIST) course can go here.

Minimum of 12 units must be selected at the 400 level. HIST400, HIST467, HIST485, HIST495 cannot count towards the 24 units of History electives. Minimum of 12 units to be selected from Non-US, Non-European HIST courses (see catalog for list of options).

Any Upper-Division Elective (300-400 level, including HIST) course can go here.

classes.cCustomNote:
Any Free Elective course can go here.

Upper-Division GE courses taken for a letter grade satisfy Major or Support course requirements which may require additional units of Free Electives to complete the 180 unit total degree requirement. Some free electives may need to be 300-400 level to ensure completion of the required minimum 60 units of upper-division. Consult a college advisor for more information.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR course or GWR exam can go here. Refer to the current catalog for prerequisites.
